newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Gensym dips.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Gensym dips.

text.p: Shares in Gensym Corp fell before Friday's market opening to stand out in quiet trading.

Gensym was trading at 4-1/2, down from a Thursday close of 5-7/8. The drop came after the Cambridge, Mass., software product and services company said it expected to report an operating loss of $0.20 to $0.30 a share before a $2 million restructuring charge, or $0.20 a share, for the second quarter.
Otherwise, traders reported little action. "There's not a whole lot going on," one said.

Among other active shares, Rhone-Poulenc Rorer, the U.S. unit of French drug and chemicals group Rhone-Poulenc, was bid at 90-1/2 from a Thursday close of 91-1/8. The French company said Thursday it would buy the rest of Rhone-Poulenc Rorer it did not already own for $4.3 billion.
Finnish telecommunications equipment maker Nokia Group was trading at 75 from a Thursday close of 74-1/2.

Traders said the American Depositary Receipt was boosted by a Salomon Brothers analysis which proposed arguments for Nokia's takeover by software giant Microsoft Corp. Microsoft was unchanged at 128-1/4.
"Should Microsoft buy Nokia? It won't happen, but it's fun to think about," the report said.
Fellow Nordic telephone equipment maker Telefon AB L.M. Ericsson was pulled higher by Nokia. It was trading at 40-5/8 from a Thursday close of 40-7/16.
